page.title: 01Rathmell North West
page.content: This is an area of farm land lying to the northwest of the village of {Rathmell}and 5km.southwest of{Settle,} the local town. Rising westwards from the floor of the valley of the river Ribble to {Rathmell Common}and a high point of 370m.(Whelpstone Crag),the undulating land is used for grazing animals and growing grass which is cut for hay or more frequently silage. Some 20 farms with their attendant outbuildings are dotted over the area. Some of them now stand derelict,others are used only as holiday homes.
